intro: Gymnogramma macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaf maidenhair fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Blechnaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, arching fronds that are typically bright green and have a feathery appearance. The plant features small, spore-bearing structures called sori, which are located on the underside of the fronds. Gymnogramma macrophylla thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for indoor and outdoor gardens.
